definition: to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
